table.name: dataset_summary
table.remarks: The dataset_summary table contains summary statistics that are calculated from the observation table.

column.name: dataset_summary_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique dataset_summary, most likely code-generated.

column.name: original_dataset_id
column.remarks: identifier of the original dataset

column.name: length_of_survey_years
column.remarks: number of years the study has been ongoing; calculated from data on import'

column.name: number_of_years_sampled
column.remarks: Number of years within period of the study that samples were taken; calculated from the data on import

column.name: std_dev_interval_betw_years
column.remarks: Standard deviation of the interval between sampling events; calculated from the data on import. A larger SD indicates a more variable sampling interval.

column.name: max_num_taxa
column.remarks: Number of unique values in the taxon table. approximate, and probably a maximum, as it may include terms like "rock", bare ground", etc.

column.name: geo_extent_bounding_box_m2
column.remarks: Area in meters squared of the study area; calculated from the data on import'

table.name: event
table.remarks: holds ancillary information associated with An observation, such as the name of the observer, environmental characteristics, or other descriptive informationi

column.name: event_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique entry, most likely code-generated.

column.name: variable_name
column.remarks: Name of variables, eg, "observer", "weather conditions"

column.name: value
column.remarks: value for the event variable, eg, "calm"

table.name: observation
table.remarks: Each observation records an observation or measurement of one taxon at one sampling location at one time. This is the central table, and links to taxa, locations, event, and summary

column.name: observation_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique entry, most likely code-generated.

column.name: event_id
column.remarks: id from event table that links the tables

column.name: dataset_summary_id
column.remarks: Dataset_summary_id from the dataset_summary table that links the tables

column.name: sampling_location_id
column.remarks: Sampling_location_id from the sampling_location table that links the tables

column.name: observation_datetime
column.remarks: Date and time that the observation was made

column.name: taxon_id
column.remarks: Taxon_id from the taxon table that links the tables

column.name: variable_name
column.remarks: Name of the variable being measured

column.name: value
column.remarks: Observation value

column.name: unit
column.remarks: Observation unit of measurement

table.name: sampling_location
table.remarks: Sampling_location is a plot, transect, quadrat, or other sampling location. One sampling location can be nested within another, and nested sampling locations are defined by a recursive relationship (self-referencing table)

column.name: sampling_location_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique entry, may be code-generated.

column.name: sampling_location_name
column.remarks: Sampling location full name

column.name: latitude
column.remarks: Latitude of the sampling location in decimal degrees, datum =WGS84

column.name: longitude
column.remarks: Longitude of the sampling location in decimal degrees, datum =WGS84

column.name: elevation
column.remarks: Sampling location elevation in meters above sea level

column.name: parent_sampling_location_id
column.remarks: Sampling_location_id from this table for the parent of this sampling location; indicates nested locations

table.name: sampling_location_ancillary
table.remarks: Each sampling_location may have ancillary information associated with it. Ancillary information includes treatments, disturbance, history, soils, vegetation, geology, or other descriptive information.

column.name: sampling_location_ancillary_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique entry, most likely code-generated.

column.name: sampling_location_id
column.remarks: Sampling_location_id from sampling_location table that links the tables

column.name: datetime
column.remarks: Year or date associated with the ancillary information, e,g, date of a treatment or disturbance, etc.

column.name: variable_name
column.remarks: Variable name, e.g., treatment, vegetation_description, history

column.name: value
column.remarks: Variable value, e.g., burned, treeline, precommercial thin

column.name: unit
column.remarks: Unit of measurement, optional

table.name: taxon
table.remarks: A taxon is a unique taxonomic entity recorded at some taxon rank. Each taxon should be associated with an authority, which can be a citation or URL. An authority taxon id (such as an ITIS TSN) should be included if available.

column.name: taxon_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique entry, most likely code-generated.

column.name: taxon_level
column.remarks: Taxon rank (e.g., species, genus, family, order, etc.)

column.name: taxon_name
column.remarks: Taxon name

column.name: authority_system
column.remarks: Citation or URL of the taxonomic authority or registry, e.g, TSN or ITIS

column.name: authority_taxon_id
column.remarks: Identifier in the authority reference, e.g., an ITIS number

table.name: taxon_ancillary
table.remarks: A taxon may have ancillary information, such as habitat, plant lifeform, reproductive status, or other descriptive information.

column.name: taxon_ancillary_id
column.remarks: identifier assigned to each unique entry, most likely code-generated.

column.name: taxon_id
column.remarks: Taxon_id from taxon table that links the tables

column.name: datetime
column.remarks: datetime value for this entry (may be automatic)

column.name: variable_name
column.remarks: Variable name, e.g., "life_history_stage"

column.name: value
column.remarks: Variable value, e.g., "juvenile"

column.name: author
column.remarks: Observer identification, e.g, "Jane Scientist"
